title: Early American Political Thought
description: The central political ideas of America's leading thinkers from the arrival of the Mayflower to the Civil War. Selections may include readings of American political ideas from Winthrop, Paine, Publius, Hamilton, de Tocqueville, Douglass, Calhoun, Thoreau, and Lincoln, among others. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE D5 except for Political Science majors.
prerequisites: Completion of GE Area A, one course from D1 (POLS 112 recommended) and one course from either D2 or D3
